title: Competency-Based Medical Education Assessment Design: Applying Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic healthcare service utilization and secondary education-level comprehension
context.additional_context: A formative assessment-centered curriculum in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment, targeting real behavioral changes linked to daily life.

learning_goals: Learners can select appropriate behavioral responses in three or more medical situation simulations.
Learners report two or more cases of applying medical competencies in real-life situations through weekly mission completion.
Learners achieve 80% or more of the behavioral assessment criteria through peer feedback and instructor evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
